definitions: a wooden crosspiece fastened over the necks of two animals and attached to the plow or cart they are to pull
a frame fitting the neck and shoulders, used for carrying pails or baskets
a part of a garment that fits the upper part of the body at the shoulders
symbolically, something that is regarded as oppressive or burdensome
examples: She carried water with a yoke.
The dress has a fitted yoke.
They threw off the yoke of tyranny.
